definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got
to harmonize the stomach and rectify qi 氣|气[qi4] (Chinese medicine)

sentences.english: The papal captain have vainly endeavoured to induce his wife to remain behind him .
sentences.chinese: 教廷的队长曾白费力气地试图说服妻子留下不去。

sentences.english: He put forth all his strength and uprooted the tree.
sentences.chinese: 他使出全部的力气，把树拔了起来。

sentences.english: I feel too tired to go out for dinner . Let's eat in again tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我累得没力气出去吃饭，今天晚上我们还是在家吃吧。

sentences.english: Learning the skills of salesmanship takes time and effort.
sentences.chinese: 学习推销技术要花时间，花力气。

sentences.english: When keyboarding, use minimum force while striking the keys.
sentences.chinese: 敲打键盘的时候，击键时要使用最小的力气。

sentences.english: Water buffaloes are stronger, and can swim.
sentences.chinese: 水牛比黄牛好，力气大，还会游泳。

sentences.english: You have to use strength and skill to pound these long nails in.
sentences.chinese: 要敲进这些长钉子，你既得有力气，又得有技巧。

sentences.english: That bellows, be like run out the energy that I finish a body.
sentences.chinese: 那一声惨叫，像是用尽我毕身的力气。

sentences.english: But while he wondered, he shot in a straight left, the weight of his body behind the blow.
sentences.chinese: 可同时左手又挥出了一个直拳，全身力气都压了上去。

sentences.english: It does not help asking the question once your anger has been aroused.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你的愤怒被激起，问你什么问题都是白费力气。

sentences.english: There was no strength in him anymore and his legs folded, his body sagged.
sentences.chinese: 他身上没有任何力气，两腿圈起，身子瘫下去了。

sentences.english: He made manful effort to the heavy furniture , but failed .
sentences.chinese: 他花了极大的力气想那个沈重的家俱，但力不从心。

sentences.english: He worked hard, though still poor in health.
sentences.chinese: 他固然身体不好，可是任务起来很卖力气。

sentences.english: Yet, young Chinese struggle to think for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 然而，年轻的中国人在为自己着想时却很费力气。

sentences.english: He makes manful effort to the heavy furniture , but fail .
sentences.chinese: 他花了极大的力气想那个沈重的家俱，但力不从心。

sentences.english: It is imperative that excess fat be avoided like the plague.
sentences.chinese: 你必须下大力气避免摄入过量的脂肪。

definition: to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it

pinyin: jiu3 niu2 er4 hu3 zhi1 li4

definition: body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
to expend a great deal of effort
